question: Lucas has a plant stand at the street bazaar. He sells three kinds of plants: orchids, lilies and sunflowers. He usually sells orchids for $3.53 per bunch, lilies for $4.777692307692308 per bunch and sunflowers for $5.522 per bunch. Lucas has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Lucas sells 21 bunchs of orchids, 21 bunchs of lilies and 38 bunchs of sunflowers, how much will he make?
answer:
Lucas will round his orchids up from $3.53 to $4, since the number following the 3 is 5 or higher.
Lucas will round his lilies up from $4.777692307692308 to $5, since the number following the 4 is 5 or higher.
Lucas will round his sunflowers up from $5.522 to $6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
Lucas sells 21 orchids*$4 = $<<21*4=84>>84
Lucas sells 21 lilies*$5 = $<<21*5=105>>105
Lucas sells 38 sunflowers*$6 = $<<38*6=228>>228
Altogether, Lucas will make $84 + $105 + $228 = $<<84+105+228=417>>417
#### 417
